abstract: The results of the government-mandated stress tests drew a dividing line between strong banks and weaker ones. And by common consensus, one of the former is JPMorgan Chase, which according to the tests needs no new capital.

lead_paragraph: The results of the government-mandated stress tests drew a dividing line between strong banks and weaker ones. And by common consensus, one of the former is JPMorgan Chase, which according to the tests needs no new capital.

headline.main: JPMorgan on Passing the Stress Tests
